# 60-Second Briefing Template

> Quick summary format for sharing findings with colleagues or stakeholders.

[← Back to Templates](/templates/README) | [← Main Guide](/README)

---

## How to Use

1. Copy everything below the line
2. Fill in the bracketed sections
3. Delete any sections that don't apply
4. Share with your team

---

## Template

---

### ⚡ 60-Second Briefing: [Topic]

**Date:** `YYYY-MM-DD` **Prepared by:** [Your name/role] **For:** [Audience]

---

#### Example Key Findings

|  #  | Finding                          | Source             |  Confidence  |
| :-: | :------------------------------- | :----------------- | :----------: |
|  1  | [Primary finding]                | [Link or citation] | High/Med/Low |
|  2  | [Secondary finding]              | [Link or citation] | High/Med/Low |
|  3  | [Additional finding if relevant] | [Link or citation] | High/Med/Low |

---

#### Example Source Verification

- [ ] Sources triangulated (Gov + Research + Peer perspectives)
- [ ] Currency verified (Published within acceptable timeframe)
- [ ] Authoritative source confirmed
- [ ] Jurisdiction matches our needs

---

#### Example Implications

> [!IMPORTANT] [One sentence: What does this mean for our work?]

---

#### Example Recommended Actions

| Priority | Action                | Owner  | Due    |
| :------: | :-------------------- | :----- | :----- |
|    1     | [Most urgent action]  | [Name] | [Date] |
|    2     | [Secondary action]    | [Name] | [Date] |
|    3     | [Follow-up if needed] | [Name] | [Date] |

---


#### Gaps / Limitations

> [!NOTE] [What couldn't you find? What uncertainties remain?]

## Example Filled In

---

### ⚡ 60-Second Briefing: NSW Nitazene Alerts Q1 2026

**Date:** `2026-01-30` **Prepared by:** Jane Smith, Peer Coordinator **For:** Clinical team meeting

---

#### Key Findings

|  #  | Finding                                          | Source         | Confidence |
| :-: | :----------------------------------------------- | :------------- | :--------: |
|  1  | 3 nitazene alerts issued by NSW Health since Dec | [NSW Health]   |    High    |
|  2  | Protonitazene detected in Sydney heroin supply   | [WEDINOS data] |   Medium   |
|  3  | No updated clinical guidance for reversal dosing | Gap identified |    N/A     |

---

#### Source Verification

- [x] Sources triangulated (Gov + Research + Peer perspectives)
- [x] Currency verified (Published within acceptable timeframe)
- [x] Authoritative source confirmed
- [ ] Jurisdiction matches our needs

---

#### Implications

> [!IMPORTANT] Staff may need refresher training on high-dose naloxone protocols for synthetic
> opioid overdoses.

---

#### Recommended Actions

| Priority | Action                             | Owner     | Due       |
| :------: | :--------------------------------- | :-------- | :-------- |
|    1     | Brief all outreach staff           | Team Lead | This week |
|    2     | Update client info sheets          | Comms     | Next week |
|    3     | Request clinical guidance from PHN | Manager   | 2 weeks   |

---
